consume(((bytes32,uint256),(address,uint.details: Only useable by portals / recipients of messagesEmits `MessageConsumed` when consuming messages

params._epoch: - The epoch that contains the message we want to consume
params._leafIndex: - The index at the level in the epoch message tree where the message is located
params._path: - The sibling path used to prove inclusion of the message, the _path length depends on the location of the L2 to L1 message in the epoch message tree.

params._epoch: - The epoch to fetch the root data for

returns._0: bytes32 - The root of the merkle tree containing the L2 to L1 messages

hasMessageBeenConsumedAtEpoch(uint256,ui.details: - This function does not throw. Out-of-bounds access is considered valid, but will always return false

params._epoch: - The epoch that contains the message we want to check
params._leafId: - The unique id of the message leaf

insert(uint256,bytes32).details: Only callable by the rollup contractEmits `RootAdded` upon inserting the root successfully

params._epoch: - The epoch in which the L2 to L1 messages reside
params._root: - The merkle root of the tree where all the L2 to L1 messages are leaves

consume(((bytes32,uint256),(address,uint.notice: Consumes an entry from the Outbox

getRootData(uint256).notice: Fetch the root data for a given epoch          Returns (0, 0) if the epoch is not proven

hasMessageBeenConsumedAtEpoch(uint256,ui.notice: Checks to see if an L2 to L1 message in a specific epoch has been consumed

insert(uint256,bytes32).notice: Inserts the root of a merkle tree containing all of the L2 to L1 messages in an epoch specified by _epoch.
